oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cokesbury Book Store opening in downtown Nashville,1958 March
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The new Cokesbury Book Store opening in downtown Nashville, with Mayor Ben West cutting ribbon, marking the official ceremony on March 3rd, 1958, at 417 Church Street. The 1958 City Directory cites Philip C. Warden, Manager. The name Cokesbury is a combination of the last names of the first two American Methodist bishops, Thomas Coke and Francis Asbury, both elected in 1784. Cokesbury is a leading nationwide retailer of Christian resources. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. Title supplied by cataloger. 6 photograph negatives : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: West, Ben, 1911-1974
